description: [Status: stable] [Name: non-lowercase-variable-in-function] [Message: Variable {name} in function should be lowercase] What it does Checks for the use of non-lowercase variable names in functions. Why is this bad? PEP 8 recommends that all function variables use lowercase names: Function names should be lowercase, with words separated by underscores as necessary to improve readability. Variable names follow the same convention as function names. mixedCase is allowed only in contexts where that's already the prevailing style (e.g. threading.py), to retain backwards compatibility. Example def my_function(a): B = a + 3 return B Use instead: def my_function(a): b = a + 3 return b

lint.pep8-naming.ignore-names.option_description:
A list of names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]

lint.pep8-naming.extend-ignore-names.option_description:
Additional names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations,
in addition to those included in ignore-names.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]
